bibl.title: Letter from Ralph Cooper Hutchison to Philip Showalter Hench, June 4, 1940

div1.p: Hutchison supplies Lazear family addresses. He will invite them to the ceremony at Washington and Jefferson College.

div1.head: Letter from Ralph Cooper Hutchison to Philip Showalter Hench, June 4, 1940

opener.dateline:
THE PRESIDENT'S OFFICE
WASHINGTON AND JEFFERSON COLLEGE
WASHINGTON, PENNSYLVANIA
June 4, 1940

div1.p:
I have just received word from a couple
of sources as to Mrs. Lazear. Her address is
116 East Padre Street, Santa Barbara, California.

They have a son, William Houston Lazear,
living at 1325 Fifteenth Street, Sacramento,
California. They have a daughter, Mrs. W. D.
Briggs, living at 106 The Uplands, Berkeley,
California. She has two children, Thomas Lazear
Briggs and Nancy Briggs.

Of course I am writing to them immediately
suggesting that they come for Founders' Day.

We are getting ready for our Commence-
ment here and I suppose you are getting ready for
your trip to Lafayette. Our congratulations and
good wishes to you as you are honored there. I wish
I could be there. As you once said about me, “I
would sure fix the tassel on your cap”!

On Monday, I will be down with Atch as
I go through for a college commencement in Virginia.
Our love to you and Mary,
div1.closer:
Fraternally yours, Hutch Doctor Philip S. Hench
Mayo Clinic
Rochester, Minnesota
RCH/M
Have your letter nice
dictating this. I will
see Pew. Suw Atch & Virgin.
love, H.
